pageContext.claim: “We're taking across all of the borders or the lines, so that insurance companies can compete.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump tried to claim this provision was in the American Health Care Act until CBS's John Dickerson pointed out it was not. Then Trump said it would be in "phase two" which "will quickly get approved" -- but that would require Democratic support in the Senate. In any case, under Obamacare, insurance companies are already allowed to form regional compacts. But insurance companies have shown little to no interest.
